name: yeison.github.com
body:
## another list of useful unix commands
* 'stat' or 'fstat'

A new unix command that I encountered today.  Do you want more details from a file than you could ever ask for?  Try running 'stat -x <filename>' (the command may be 'fstat' depending on your flavor of *nix.


  Here is some example output:

    stat -x grep.c
   
    File: "grep.c"
    Size: 1939         FileType: Regular File
    Mode: (0644/-rw-r--r--)         Uid: (  501/  Yeison)  Gid: (   20/   staff)
    Device: 1,1   Inode: 227606880    Links: 1
    Access: Wed Oct 31 21:13:50 2012
    Modify: Wed Oct 31 20:38:15 2012
    Change: Wed Oct 31 20:38:15 2012
